section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Level of service" includes the number of round trips operated on a route and the number of stations along a route.
"Route" means a passenger railroad service line described under subsections (b) through (d) of this section.

text.section:
The Administration shall continue to operate the following passenger railroad services at levels of service at least equivalent to the level of service established as of July 1, 1981:
The CSX line between Brunswick and the District of Columbia;
The Amtrak line between Penn Station in Baltimore and the District of Columbia; and
The CSX line between Camden Station in Baltimore and the District of Columbia.

The Administration shall continue to operate the passenger railroad service on the Amtrak line between Perryville and Penn Station in Baltimore at the level of service at least equivalent to the level of service established as of May 1, 1991.

The Administration shall continue to operate the passenger services on the CSX line between Frederick and Point of Rocks at the level of service at least equivalent to the level of service established as of December 17, 2001.

section.section: The Administration may not close a station on any route before June 30, 2008.

Notwithstanding the provisions of this section, the Administration may close the Jessup Station on the CSX line between Camden Station in Baltimore and the District of Columbia at any time if the Administration finds that the ridership at the Jessup Station does not warrant keeping the station open.

text.section: The Administration shall adopt regulations to facilitate the transportation of bicycles on board passenger railroad services.

section.section: Until a public hearing is held on the matter, the Administration may not establish or abandon a station on a route.
The Administration shall give notice of a hearing at least 30 days before the hearing.

The notice shall be:
Published once a week for 2 successive weeks in two or more newspapers of wide circulation throughout the Administration's commuter rail service area; and
Posted in all of the Administration's offices, stations, and terminals and all of its commuter rail rolling stock in revenue service.
The 30-day period begins when the notice first appears in the newspaper.

If the Administration gives inadequate notice of a public hearing on a matter described in paragraph (1) of this subsection, the Administration may not establish or abandon a station unless a legally sufficient public hearing is held.
For the purposes of this paragraph, notice shall be considered inadequate if:

The Administration may implement a change of policy on a matter described in paragraph (1) of this subsection only during the time period beginning 6 weeks after the date of the public hearing and ending 6 months after the date of the public hearing.
